document.docAuthor: Rédei, Dávid, Zhu, Xudong & Kondorosy, Előd
document.masterDocTitle: The identity of Orthaea maculifera, with proposal of a new synonymy (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Rhyparochromidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The identity of Orthaea maculifera, with proposal of a new synonymy (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Rhyparochromidae)

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Pendulinus uniguttatus
Thunberg, 1822
: 6
. Lectotype (
Kondorosy et al. 2014
: 571
): ♂, Cap[ut bonae spei] [= South Africa : Cape of Good Hope] (in error); UPSZ !

Pendulinus guttatus
Thunberg, 1825
: 5
. Neotype (
Kondorosy et al. 2014
: 571
): the lectotype of
P. uniguttatus
. Junior objective synonym of
P. uniguttatus
.

Dallas, 1852
: 572
. Lectotype (

): ♂, India , N. Bengal; BMNH ! Synonymized by
Stål ( 1874 : 162 )
.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Orthaea maculifera
Uhler, 1861
: 286
. Syntype (s): ♀, China : Hong Kong (
Uhler 1860 : 229
); USNM ! New subjective synonym.

Orthaea maculifera :
Stål 1874
: 167
( catalogue , distribution, as of unknown identity),

: 232
( catalogue , distribution, as of unknown identity).

Pachybrachius maculiferus :

( catalogue , distribution).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Bibliographies for
M. uniguttatus
were provided by
Slater ( 1964
: 1241 ) and
Kondorosy et al. ( 2014
: 571 ).

Type material examined. Lectotype
(present designation): female, “ Orthaea \ maculifera \ Hong Kong ” [handwritten], “ Orthaea \ maculifera \ Hong \ Kong [handwritten] det UHLER [printed]” [with printed black frame], “PRUhler \ Collection” [printed], “TypeNo. [printed] \ 25749 [handwritten] \ U.S. N.M. [printed]” [red]; pinned, segments II–IV of both antennae, left fore, left mid, both hind legs, and tarsi of the remaining legs lacking, wings slightly damaged and distorted by pin; deposited in USNM (
Figs. 1–3
).

Discussion. The identity of
Metochus uniguttatus
has been clarified by
Kondorosy et al. ( 2014 )
. This species was recorded from several localities in India (including the Andaman Islands), Sri Lanka , Burma ( Myanmar ), Macau and Hong Kong of southern China , Indochina, Taiwan , the Ryukyu Archipelago of Japan , the Philippines , Malay Peninsula, and the Malay Archipelago, but all previous records are in need of verification (
Kondorosy et al. 2014
).

The name
Orthaea maculifera
was validly proposed by
Uhler ( 1861 )
by a bibliographic reference (indication) to his earlier description (
Uhler 1860
) of this biological species without proposing an available name due to an inadvertent error (
ICZN 1999 , Articles 12.1–12.2
). A single specimen of
O . maculifera
, undoubtedly belonging to the type series, was found in the USNM (
Figs. 1–3
). The original description does not make it unambiguously clear that it was based on a single specimen, therefore, disagreeing with the interpretation of
Péricart ( 2001 )
and following
ICZN ( 1999 , Recommendation 73 F)
we explicitly designate the studied specimen as the lectotype . Reexamination of the specimen leaves no doubt that it is conspecific with the lectotype of
Metochus uniguttatus (
Kondorosy et al. 2014
)
therefore the subjective synonymy of the two names is hereby proposed.
